values:
Watching Straight Time yesterday reminded me how much I love that film.
I'm thinking to reread No Beast So Fierce and get into that vibe again.

http://kaenhoushaki.livejournal.com/149400.html

It's been such a while since I first heard of Straight Time and SO BADLY wanted to see it.

http://kaenhoushaki.livejournal.com/153410.html

March 8 2007 was when I finished the book.
It's been a year since my obsession.

<3

And I'm still so obsessed

In fact.

I want to read it again.
 
yay!

I didn't see the movie until April 4. ON VHS. LAWL.

<lj-embed id="16" />

This isn't in the novel the way the movie shows it.
Dembo does kill Willy...but differently.
In the novel, Dembo shaves his head (to change identity because the cops were able to identify the living robber as 'Maxwell Dembo') and confronts Willy at his home and then in his car. In the movie, Max is mad that Willy left he and Jerry behind. IN THE NOVEL HOWEVER, Max is mad because he thinks Willy told the police his identity (Willy was the only other person who knew about the robbery). After calling him a rat, he shoots Willy in the knee and then again until he dies.
Dembo then takes Willy's dead body off road and pisses on his corpse. BRUTAL.

I kinda like the movie's way better. GIMMIE A BIG BEAR HUG! *BANG*

These scenes were kinda-sorta in the novel

<lj-embed id="14" />

<lj-embed id="15" />

FIRST OFF:
In the novel, Willy wasn't with Max and Jerry...instead, there was a character named Aaron who tagged along to cut off the police response system. Aaron gets caught and arrested.
SECOND OFF:
The bit about Max taking too long to bag and run didn't exist in the novel at all.
THIRD OFF:
The police do show and there's a bit of a chase, like the movie. Just minus the get-away car bit....because again...Willy wasn't with them. Willy had to take a drug test.

The way Jerry dies, however...that's in the novel just the way the movie shows it.

<lj-embed id="13" />

Best scene in the entire movie, I believe.
Like the novel...Max and Jerry rob a bank. 

Shame Aaron isn't in the movie version. NO RED EITHER. NOR AUGIE. NOR MARY. :C
(It would have been awesome to see Max fucking Mary and the daughter walking in on them in the movie, like the novel version. "Far out orgasm" Max says. hahah)

<lj-embed id="12" />

A very worthy performance by both Hoffman and Stanton.
One of my favorite scenes.

However this scene isn't in the novel, it was still a great surprise to see the author play a role in the film. :)

<lj-embed id="10" />

This scene is one of the closest scenes to the book. (except the parole officer's ass sticking out, but that was a great twist!)

<lj-embed id="9" />

This part isn't too different from the book.
Dembo had forgotten about the matches/burnt spoon and gets arrested and sent to jail again.

<lj-embed id="8" />

This part is very different from the book.
First off, it wasn't Willy...it was a character named Augie.
Second off, Dembo allows him to fix...because Augie was looking very ill.
Third off, watching Augie fix made Max crave a taste but not shoot up.
Dembo be a money ho. Storin cash in his pants.

HOSHIT IT'S TROY CAMERON.

troytroytroytroytroytroy. <3

Exactly like how I imagined him while reading the novel, DOG EAT DOG.
They gotta make a movie out of it....and Troy BETTER LOOK LIKE HIM. ^^^^^^
I don't want no piece-of-shit actor like Johnny Depp playing this motherfucker.

OH MY GOSH. I HAVEn'T BEEN ON HERE IN A WHILE.
That's going to change.

Lately:
I've picked up Little Boy Blue, another Edward Bunker novel (that supposedly has a lil Max Dembo cameo) so I look forward to reading that. I also read somewhere that a never-been-published early writing (before No Beast So Fierce) of Bunker's is finally going to be released. It's called 'Stark'
I look forward to that too...I think it's releasing next month.


Also, I'M TEMPTED ABOUT GETTING THIS

EDIT: 11/08/07 ~ Nevermind...I bought it.
I COULDN'T RESIST

LOVE THAT SHIRT. XD
I saw a shirt like it at rustyzipper.com BUT IT'S TOO SMALL. D8

ROFLROFL. Brubaker was on AMC and I had NO idea M. Emmett Walsh was in it. ROFLROFLROFL.
Even funnier, Walsh's character name is WOODWARD. ROFLROFL.

There's a scene when Brubaker (played by Robert Redford) is talking to "Woodward" (Emmett Walsh).
And I'm like....w-what-w-wait? Woodward is....over there??? o.o

WALSH: *to Redford* "KNOW A GUY NAMED MAX DEMBO? SHORT. BIG NOSE. LONG HAIR. MUSTACHE?"
REDFORD: .............???? Uh, BERNSTEIN? But....he didn't have a mustache though, sorry. O_O I guess I don't.

DEMBO: WOODWARD!
WALSH: YES?
DEMBO: WHA? EARL?
WALSH: DEMBO!
REDFORD: OOCCOO?!??!?
WALSH and DEMBO: WTF! @__@

geeez what's up with me today. XDDD

I really enjoyed Dog Eat Dog. Edward Bunker's lurid and gritty writtings always entertain me. (It may not top my favorite read, No Beast So Fierce, but I loved this book no doubt.)
We focus upon three characters - Troy, 'Mad Dog' McCain, and Diesel. All three having troubled pasts and desperate needs, like all of Bunker's criminals. My favorite part was a later scene - when Troy and Diesel mugged the drug dealer, Moon Eyes, and drove off in a stolen vehicle...later being caught by the police. SUCH IRONY.
Overall, it's a great crime thriller read~ which is much expected from Edward Bunker anyway!

I'm suddenly obsessed with Willy Darin.
Especially Busey's Willy Darin.



~~~


DEMBOANGST!



I loved how Gary Busey's kid plays Willy's kid in the movie. Cute.



Dwar??? ROFL

Shame Max kills Willy in the end.
It's different in the book. Willy is killed because Max knew Willy told the police about the heist. It angered Max and drove him to murder.
However in the movie, Willy just chickens out and leaves with the getaway car- angering Max and blaming Jerry's death on Willy when in reality it was Max's fault.

I really want to do a 'cross-over' minicomic.
No Beast So Fierce and Animal Factory cross-over.

Something like....Max Dembo and Ron Decker share a cell in San Quentin.
Yep. :3

Finished reading The Animal Factory. I'm still reading Dog Eat Dog.
Lovin' Eddie Bunker more and more.
Oh boredom... XD

The next Bunker book I'm reading, Animal Factory is indeed a movie as well...but I'll probably just download it and see it AFTER I read the book. I have a bias against recent-made films...(the novel was written in 1977...the movie was filmed in 2000...why such a loooong wait??) ....so hmm. I'd rather read the book first. I don't want the film to kill it for me.

I ordered two more Edward Bunker novels..... Animal Factory and Dog Eat Dog from Amazon.
I'm pretty excited about reading those two!! :D

One of my top favorite excerpts from No Beast So Fierce. Max Dembo's letter seeking a job:

"Dear Sir,
Do you have a position for a journeyman burglar, con man, forger, and car theif; also with esperience as armed robber, pimp, card cheat, and several other things. I smoked marijuana at twelve (in the '40s) and shot heroin at sixteen. I have no experience with LSD and methedrine. They came to popularity since my imprisonment. I've buggered pretty young boys and feminine homosexuals (but only when locked up away from women). In the idiom of jails, prisons, and gutters (some plush gutters) I'm a motherfucker! Not literally, for I don't remember my mother. In my world the term used as I used it, is a boast of being hell on wheels, outrageously unpredictable, a virtuoso of crime. Of course by being a motherfucker in that world I'm a piece of garbage in yours. 
Do you have a job?" 

I'm re-reading some parts of the book. Still find it amusing. XD

Found the time to listen to the Straight Time commentary with the director Ulu Grosbard and Dustin Hoffman! Very interesting background information! :D


Some very interesting things I got out of it:

  • Dustin Hoffman spent lots of time researching the role with Edward Bunker. He loved getting an understanding of Bunker and how it was really like to be out of the joint, then taken out into the roughs of society. Hoffman learned and actually remembered a lot from Bunker.
  • The scene when Max is with Willy and his family was totally improvised.
  • Hoffman based the pull-Earl's-pants-down humiliation off an embarrassing childhood memory he had. A bully had done that to him in front of everyone in the lunch cafeteria, including a girl he had a crush on.
  • The scene when Manny doesn't show up with the guns for Max and Jerry was actually based off something Bunker had done the day before that scene was shot. Bunker was talking with someone and had a fight. They decided to use it.
  • During the filming of the scene when Max and Jerry rob the jewelry store, another robbery was going on in Beverly Hills...VERY similar to the scene they were acting. Coincidence!
  • Hoffman wanted to include a scene in the movie that shows Dembo's last days in prison...being a star in prison, getting messages from a young fellow, having it made!...Then released into society as not a star, but a lowlife...an "invisible" being in society. I would have LOVED that scene.
  • At the end of the movie- the mug shots were of course old photographs of Hoffman. When Bunker was looking at them, the last photo, Bunker commented, "...There you are...you could have been one of us." That bit amused me.

Dembo indeed wears LOUD shirts.
This amuses me ...because my VHS version was so vintage, all the colors looked grey and dark.
Now I watch the clear-and-touched-up-DVD version...and I'm like WHOA, He seriously is wearing a LOUD pink/blue/orange shirt!!

AND I thought my drawings were exaggerating.....
I GUESS NOT. HAHAHAHHAAHHAHAAHHAHA!!!

If you noticed in my fanart of Dembo, there's something up about his eyebrows



Because.....A piece of his right eyebrow is missing.

I GET THAT THEME STUCK IN MY HEAD SOMETIMES!!!!

What can I say, the same guy who did some music for Saturday Night Fever (my second top favorite film ever), David Shire came up with this theme too. (EVEN MORE AMUSING, David Shire also composed that eerie theme from All the President's Men too...ANOTHER top favorite movie of mine. XD HAHAH)

I. LOVE. DAVID. SHIRE!

STRAIGHT TIME POSSIBLE SLASH PAIRS. (PART 2) (SO OTP! XD) Max Dembo / Jerry Schue (This one is my FAVORITE pairing) (actual subtitles from the movie. LOVE that line.) Max gets kicks out of teasing Jerry like that. X3 This scene here...Max Dembo and Jerry Schue...taken out of context... NOT a manipulation....IT AMUSES ME SO. TALK ABOUT SUBTEXT, BUT IT'S SO FUNNY~ heheheheheh...! Then there's the scene when Jerry dies. A cop shoots Jerry and Max shoots the cop...then watches Jerry die. There's no talking in this scene...just dramatic music and long expressed stares. The last expression tells me: "Great....I lost my most loyal bitch....Now what? ...I know, blame Willy!" XD

STRAIGHT TIME POSSIBLE SLASH PAIRS. (PART 1) (SO OTP! XD) Max Dembo / Willy Darin Willy to me, seems like the bitch in this pair. Willy, despite his height, is not exactly tough-stuff, like Max. Max, though.... wants a piece of his cheeky face. :3 Willy RECOILS. heheheh. Aw...big bear hug for Willy!!

I GOT IT.

I'm soooo posting screencaps ASAP. XDDDD

Big chance I'll recieve my DVD tomorrow or the day after. It's been shipped already so all I do is wait a bit more. In the meantime... Since I posted some German posters, I'll post more from all over that I found. VINTAGE and everything, ofcourse. You see, the American Poster kinda sucks... If I wanted a Straight Time poster for my room, I'd rather get a foreign one...they look better. X3 Like this one from Mexico. It's got more Dembo. :) However I really love the French poster. *_* OR THE JAPANESE ONE. The Japanese one is my favorite! It's also the most expensive on ebay........ DANG IT. I guess I'm better off DRAWING my own Straight Time poster. XDDDD I can't wait. SCREEEEENCAPS, GUUHHHHH! That would mean more Straight Time fanart! :DDDD

Only little more of a wait to go! I recieve my copy in just a few days. :D In the meantime, even Entertainment Weekly (a mag that usually disappoints me) realized Straight Time is a great Hoffman flick~! Niiiice. I'm SO excited for that commentary, man!

It amuses me...the fact that I draw Max Dembo with a piece of his right eyebrow missing...because after seeing the movie 3812739812732+ times I noticed it. XDDDD

It's adoring~!
XDDDDD

Hello, 
kaenhoushaki
 here, actually...

I just want to use this journal as a scrap journal for my fan-girling, ideas, point-outs, fan art, manipulations, whatever, about the book 'No Beast So Fierce' and the movie 'Straight Time'.

The DVD release of 'Straight Time' in May 23rd. I CAN'T WAIT. MUST TAKE SCREENCAPS!!!! :D
In the meantime, I'LL RE-READ THE BOOK!!!! :D
